fields.Title of Presentation: Social Constructionism and the Social Meaning of Corporate Reporting:  SASB as Claimsmaker
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: ABLJ Invited Scholars Colloquium, Academy of Legal Studies in Business (ALSB) National Conference
fields.Sponsoring Organization: Academy of Legal Studies in Business/American Business Law Journal
fields.Description/Abstract: This project explores the sociological significance of the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board (SASB) approach to corporate sustainability reporting (sustainability reporting).  Most sustainability reporting initiatives consist of a voluntary reporting framework, to be used and adapted at the whim of the reporting company.  SASB, by contrast, focuses on leveraging the existing legal definition of “material” information for SEC reporting purposes.  The paper argues that SASB’s unique focus reimagines sustainability reporting as mainstream disclosure, signaling societal change toward expanded corporate responsibilities.  The paper uses social constructionism to illustrate the connections between SASB’s reimagining of “material” information and what it tells us about ourselves as a society.
